meanings.sent1: Tommy felt like a schnooks when he realized he had been tricked.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a schnooks and fall for that scam!
meanings.sent3: The schnooks in the story always believed everything they heard.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a schnooks in a world full of cunning foxes.
meanings.sent5: Being a schnooks can lead to being taken advantage of easily.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to schnooks the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: It's not right to schnooks people for personal gain.
meanings.sent3: The magician schnooksed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She felt like someone had schnooksed her when she found out the truth.
meanings.sent5: Schnooksing others will only lead to trouble in the end.

meanings.definition: A term of endearment for a loved one.
meanings.sent1: Hey schnooks, how was your day?
meanings.sent3: She called her best friend schnooks as a joke.
meanings.sent4: To her, he was not just a schnooks but her whole world.
meanings.sent5: Being called schnooks always brings a smile to her face.
